name: Crowned Heads - Mother Church - Churchill
additionalNotes: Crowned Heads is known for drawing much of their inspiration from music, and Crowned Heads Mother Church premium cigars pay homage to the famous Ryman Auditorium in Nashville, affectionately referred to as the “Mother Church” of country music. Available only as a 7x48 Churchill vitola, these delectably good smokes are made with masterfully aged Nicaraguan long fillers bunched inside a hearty Connecticut Broadleaf binder all dressed in a top-shelf Ecuadorian Corojo 99 wrapper. Like much of the other top-rated Crowned Heads blends that I enjoy, Mother Church is crafted by hand at Tabacalera Pichardo in Nicaragua. Once I put a flame to the foot of Mother Church, my palate is greeted with a bold and rich medium-full bodied smoke loaded with complex notes of roasted nuts, spice, cocoa, charred hickory, and a delectable tobacco sweetness.
